reviews.review: This movie was hella tight lmao
Best film I've ever seen. Six crying laughing emojis out of five. ??
best movie i ever watched never thought i would want to fuck every main character at once
My daughter loved it! It's worth a watch, take th kids and have a good time.

The emoji movie is truly a seminal piece of work it has a strange premise which at first seems to be a sad cash grab to take advantage of the popularity of the emoji but as soon as you watch the movie you find out quickly that the movie is very aware of itself it asks important questions about the world and out future such as what makes emoji's so widely popular and will emojis eventually become a staple of language making a sort of loop to out begginings with hieroglyphic languages. It doesnt awnser these questions directly it makes them very clear that it cant but that it you should find the awnsers yourself. in summary if you want to see a smart animated movie that asks important questions and provides an awareness of the consumer culture it exists in.

Imagine having the opportunity to see the premiere of Star Wars back when it first came out. You now have that opportunity. The emoji movie is a masterpiece of filmmaking. It crosses all genres, having moments of intense suspense, and some hilarious laughs. There is also a love story for the ages. One so powerful that not even Shakespeare would have been able to properly write about. This movie IS perfect. The only thing that disappointed me about this film was that I will never get to see it again for the first time. I would give 6 stars if I could.

please don't see it ironically. it's not bad enough to be funny, it's just painful. YOU ARE GIVING THEM A SEQUEL. YOU ARE CREATING THE WORLD IN WHICH AN EMOJI MOVIE 2 COMES OUT. I SAW IT, I REGRET IT. DO. NOT. SEE. THIS. TRAVESTY.
I died by watching this filth

Honestly the Emoji Movie contained lots of great messages that are important for kids to hear. It also has lots of funny jokes and cool adventures. I dont know why it is rated so low. I am definetly going to watch it again when it comes out for DVD
